meanings.definition: Sow (a crop) beneath a growing crop to provide additional yield.
meanings.sent1: Farmers often undersow clover beneath their main crop to increase overall production.
meanings.sent2: The practice of undersowing wheat under the corn has proven successful in boosting harvests.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit tried undersowing carrots under the lettuce, hoping for a secret garden.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like undersowing seeds of joy in the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The idea of undersowing new ideas in young minds can lead to a brighter future.
